instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: a1534 new screem + battery disconnect button
threads.message: Now the new screen is working but i had to install it in and out 3 times, put back the original broken screen too. So the original broken has backlight and picture, then i replaced the new one, no BL no picture, put back the original, same no BL no picture, the same thing 3 times, and i think the last time what i did differently is the actually lift up the board to remove it from the battery, before i only pushed the battery disconnect button, im not sure if that fixed it but it seems like, what does that battery disconnect button do?

threads.title: a1534 new screem + battery disconnect button
threads.message: It disables all power from the board and should always be done before touching anything.
